intro: Secamone cristata subsp. cristata, commonly known as the cristate secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its branched, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, clustered in cymes, and bloom during the wet season. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open woodland or grassland habitats.
